'''Nintendo'''{{fn|Also known as '''Nintendo Co., Ltd.''' (or 任天堂株式会社 in {{w|Japanese language|Japanese}})}} is a {{w|Japanese}} multinational video game company headquartered in {{w|Kyoto}}. It is responsible for the creation and development of {{w|The Legend of Zelda}} and {{w|Super Mario}} franchises.

== In the ''Minecraft'' franchise ==
* There is a [[Super Mario Mash-Up Pack]].{{only|switch|new 3ds|short=1}}
* ''[[Minecraft]]'' exists for the following consoles made by Nintendo: {{w|Nintendo Switch}},{{note|Despite not being released yet for the {{w|Switch 2}}, it can still be played on it via {{w|backward compatibility}}.}} {{w|Nintendo 3DS}}{{note|It can only be played on New 3DS/2DS models for technical reasons.}} and {{w|Wii U}}.
** {{MCD}}, {{MCL}}, and {{MCSM}} can also be played on Nintendo consoles, with ''Dungeons'' and ''Legends'' being playable on Switch, and ''Story Mode'' being playable on both Wii U and Switch.

== External references ==
* The Challanger Pack 7 DLC for [[Super Smash Bros. Ultimate]], a game owned by Nintendo, adds [[Steve]] and [[Alex]] as playable fighters.

== History ==
In 1889, {{w|Fusajiro Yamauchi}} created a company called Nintendo to make {{w|Hanafuda|''Hanafuda'' cards}}. Later in 1977, {{w|Hiroshi Yamautchi}} turned Nintendo into a {{w|video game industry|video game company}}.
* In 2015, Nintendo teamed up with [[Mojang]] and [[4J Studios]] to create the ''[[Wii U Edition]]'' of ''Minecraft''.
* In September of 2017, Nintendo, Mojang and [[Other Ocean Interactive]] created the ''[[New Nintendo 3DS Edition]]'' of ''Minecraft'', 2 months after the discontinuation of the {{w|New Nintendo 3DS}}.
* In 2018, Nintendo, Mojang and 4J Studios created the ''[[Nintendo Switch Edition]]''.
** Later that same year, Nintendo Switch Edition was replaced with {{BE}}.
* In 2020, Nintendo introduced the Challenge Pack 7 DLC to Super Smash Bros. Ultimate, which added [[Steve]] and [[Alex]] as playable fighters.
